Title: LLM for Test Script Generation and Migration: Challenges, Capabilities, and Opportunities
Abstract: this paper investigates the application of large language models  large language model  in the domain of mobile application test script generation. test script generation is a vital component of software testing enabling efficient and reliable automation of repetitive test tasks. however existing generation approaches often encounter limitations such as difficulties in accurately capturing and reproducing test scripts across diverse devices platforms and applications. these challenges arise due to differences in screen sizes input modalities platform behaviors application programming interface inconsistencies and application architectures. overcoming these limitations is crucial for achieving robust and comprehensive test automation.by leveraging the capabilities of large language model we aim to address these challenges and explore its potential as a versatile tool for test automation. we investigate how well large language model can adapt to diverse devices and systems while accurately capturing and generating test scripts. additionally we evaluate its cross platform generation capabilities by assessing its ability to handle operating system variations and platform specific behaviors. furthermore we explore the application of large language model in cross app migration where it generates test scripts across different applications and software environments based on existing scripts.throughout the investigation we analyze its adaptability to various user interfaces app architectures and interaction patterns ensuring accurate script generation and compatibility. the findings of this research contribute to the understanding of large language model‚äô capabilities in test automation. ultimately this research aims to enhance software testing practices empowering app developers to achieve higher levels of software quality and development efficiency.
